hello. how do i instal a soundblaster 16: is it a PnP sb16 or a non-PnP sb16 (very important difference)?
do you have the card physically in front of you (outside the box)?
lsmod|grep ^sb
use #flood
i know i have a 16 or 32 bit awe compatible driver installed in windoze
is it a genuine sb16 or a clone?
it'd be easier if you physically inspected the card
its a creative labs soundblaster 16 pnp
lsmod|grep ^sb
that command had no visuable effect
good
sudo modprobe snd-sb16 index=0 isapnp=1
what did that command return?
you're positive it's "PnP"?
sudo modprobe snd-sb16 index=0 isapnp=0
and the result?
just returns you to prompt?
please paste in #flood the output of `cat /proc/asound/cards'
so it wasn't PnP after all
echo snd-sb16 | sudo tee -a /etc/modules
then: echo "options snd-sb16 index=0 isapnp=0" | sudo tee -a /etc/modprobe.d/snd-sb16
now you can use Applications>Sound & Video>Volume Control to unmute and adjust the volume
and when you reboot, your sound card will be used.
